intro: Tondin, commonly known as the Indian chervil, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are often used as a culinary herb, similar to parsley, and it is also valued for its medicinal properties. Tondin is also known for its aromatic qualities and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
